item.title: Bookdown for the scientific notebook
item.description: I’m launching a new scientific notebook using blogdown, following the install instructions at https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/workflow.html and using Yihui’s Xmin theme. I modified some stuff in layouts/ to get syntax highlighting and to show tags and categories. The example posts are still there for now, though I can safely delete them as they can be found elsewhere. I’ve set up a netifly account to automagically build the site, and serve it at brucekendall.

item.title: Customizing the Xmin theme
item.description: XMin is the first Hugo theme I have designed. The original reason that I wrote it was I needed a minimal example of Hugo themes when I was writing the blogdown book. Basically I wanted a simple theme that supports a navigation menu, a home page, other single pages, lists of pages, blog posts, categories, tags, and RSS. That is all. Nothing fancy. In terms of CSS and JavaScript, I really want to keep them minimal.

item.title: The prevalence of bad matrix models
item.description: My students in 211 have revealed that there are an astonishing number of animal population matrices still being published with fundamental errors, including no survival in the reproductive term, failing to hit first breeding in models with post-breeding censuses, and incorrect maturation fractions in stage-for-age models (basically, if stage duration is T, they say that the maturation fraction is \(1/T\)).
